search_results.snippet: The name pangolin comes from the Malay word "pengguling", meaning "something that rolls up". It is found in tropical regions throughout Africa and Asia. Pangolins have large, protective keratin scales covering their skin; they are the only known mammals with this adaptation.
search_results.title: Pangolin - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: Pangolins, often called scaly anteaters, are covered in tough, overlapping scales. These burrowing mammals eat ants and termites using an extraordinarily long, sticky tongue, and are able to quickly roll themselves up into a tight ball when threatened.
search_results.title: What Is A Pangolin? | Save Pangolins
